title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Tue Apr 10, 2018 | 7:45am EDT Editors Choice Pictures 
President Trump receives a briefing from senior military leadership accompanied by Vice President Mike Pence and National Security Adviser John Bolton at the Cabinet Room of the White House. REUTERS/Carlos Barria Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 President Trump receives a briefing from senior military leadership accompanied by Vice President Mike Pence and National Security Adviser John Bolton at the Cabinet Room of the White House. REUTERS/Carlos Barria Close 1 / 24 
A protester is escorted out by the the police after breaking through the barriers, as actor and comedian Bill Cosby arrives for the first day of his sexual assault retrial at the Montgomery County Courthouse in Norristown, Pennsylvania.... more Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 A protester is escorted out by the the police after breaking through the barriers, as actor and comedian Bill Cosby arrives for the first day of his sexual assault retrial at the Montgomery County Courthouse in Norristown, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Jessica Kourkounis Close 2 / 24 
A crane is used to move a humpback whale stranded at Punta Mogotes beach in Mar de Plata, Argentina. REUTERS/Stringer Reuters / Tuesday, April 10, 2018 A crane is used to move a humpback whale stranded at Punta Mogotes beach in Mar de Plata, Argentina. REUTERS/Stringer Close 3 / 24 
A Central American migrant, moving in a caravan through Mexico, prays inside the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe as he arrives in Mexico City. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 A Central American migrant, moving in a caravan through Mexico, prays inside the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe as he arrives in Mexico City. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Close 4 / 24 
Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is seen through reflective glass as he sits in the office of Senator Bill Nelson (D-FL) while he waits for a meeting in the Hart Senate Office Building in Washington. REUTERS/Leah Millis Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is seen through reflective glass as he sits in the office of Senator Bill Nelson (D-FL) while he waits for a meeting in the Hart Senate Office Building in Washington. REUTERS/Leah Millis Close 5 / 24 
Bicycles of various bike-sharing services are seen at a vacant lot in Wuhan, Hubei province, China. REUTERS/Stringer Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 Bicycles of various bike-sharing services are seen at a vacant lot in Wuhan, Hubei province, China. REUTERS/Stringer Close 6 / 24 
French gendarmes stand on a road near burning debris during an evacuation operation in the zoned ZAD (Deferred Development Zone) in Notre-Dame-des-Landes, near Nantes, France. REUTERS/Stephane Mahe Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 French gendarmes stand on a road near burning debris during an evacuation operation in the zoned ZAD (Deferred Development Zone) in Notre-Dame-des-Landes, near Nantes, France. REUTERS/Stephane Mahe Close 7 / 24 
Amirah al-Turkistani, a graphic design lecturer at Jeddah International College, rides her bicycle in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. REUTERS/Reem Baeshen Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 Amirah al-Turkistani, a graphic design lecturer at Jeddah International College, rides her bicycle in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. REUTERS/Reem Baeshen Close 8 / 24 
U.S. first lady Melania Trump speaks during a listening session with students at the White House. REUTERS/Joshua Roberts Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 U.S. first lady Melania Trump speaks during a listening session with students at the White House. REUTERS/Joshua Roberts Close 9 / 24 
Rachele-Ngabausi, 2, injured by militiamen when they attacked the village of Tchee, stands in an Internally Displaced Camp in Bunia, Ituri province, eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. According to witnesses, militiamen killed her pregnant mother,... more Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 Rachele-Ngabausi, 2, injured by militiamen when they attacked the village of Tchee, stands in an Internally Displaced Camp in Bunia, Ituri province, eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. According to witnesses, militiamen killed her pregnant mother, her three brothers and chopped off her sister's arm. REUTERS/Goran Tomasevic Close 10 / 24 
A pensioner raises his umbrella during a protest in favour of higher state pensions, at the town hall in Bilbao, Spain. REUTERS/Vincent West Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 A pensioner raises his umbrella during a protest in favour of higher state pensions, at the town hall in Bilbao, Spain. REUTERS/Vincent West Close 11 / 24 
A woman uses a razor blade to shave her son's head on a pavement along a market area in Kolkata, India. REUTERS/Rupak De Chowdhuri Reuters / Tuesday, April 10, 2018 A woman uses a razor blade to shave her son's head on a pavement along a market area in Kolkata, India. REUTERS/Rupak De Chowdhuri Close 12 / 24 
Britain's Prince Charles visits Mount Nhulun for a ceremonial welcome with leaders of the Dhimurru and Rirratjingu Aboriginal Corporations, in Australia. Arthur Edwards/Pool via Reuters Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 Britain's Prince Charles visits Mount Nhulun for a ceremonial welcome with leaders of the Dhimurru and Rirratjingu Aboriginal Corporations, in Australia. Arthur Edwards/Pool via Reuters Close 13 / 24 
Police detain a woman belonging to the Dalit community as she shouts slogans during a protest against the Dalit killings last week, during a nationwide strike organised by various Dalit organisations, in Kochi, India. REUTERS/Sivaram V Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 Police detain a woman belonging to the Dalit community as she shouts slogans during a protest against the Dalit killings last week, during a nationwide strike organised by various Dalit organisations, in Kochi, India. REUTERS/Sivaram V Close 14 / 24 
Students dance during a party as they mark the 25th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's election as the chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK. KCNA/via Reuters Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 Students dance during a party as they mark the 25th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's election as the chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK. KCNA/via Reuters Close 15 / 24 
Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon uses a VR headset to take a virtual tour of the emperor's residential quarters during a visit to the Forbidden City in Beijing. REUTERS/Thomas Peter Reuters / Tuesday, April 10, 2018 Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon uses a VR headset to take a virtual tour of the emperor's residential quarters during a visit to the Forbidden City in Beijing. REUTERS/Thomas Peter Close 16 / 24 
Relatives of man who died after consuming tainted homemade alcohol cry outside of a hospital in Cicalengka, Bandung Regency, West Java, Indonesia. Antara Foto/Raisan Al Farisi/ via REUTERS Reuters / Tuesday, April 10, 2018 Relatives of man who died after consuming tainted homemade alcohol cry outside of a hospital in Cicalengka, Bandung Regency, West Java, Indonesia. Antara Foto/Raisan Al Farisi/ via REUTERS Close 17 / 24 
A stuntman performs a test ride on a motorcycle inside the "Well of Death" arena during a fair in Bhaktapur, Nepal. REUTERS/Navesh Chitrakar Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 A stuntman performs a test ride on a motorcycle inside the "Well of Death" arena during a fair in Bhaktapur, Nepal. REUTERS/Navesh Chitrakar Close 18 / 24 
Rescue workers retrieve a body from the top of an open top, double-decker sightseeing bus after it crashed into some low-lying tree branches, in Zurrieq, Malta. REUTERS/Darrin Zammit Lupi Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 Rescue workers retrieve a body from the top of an open top, double-decker sightseeing bus after it crashed into some low-lying tree branches, in Zurrieq, Malta. REUTERS/Darrin Zammit Lupi Close 19 / 24 
Adam Peaty of England competes in the men's 50m breaststroke at the Commonwealth Games. REUTERS/David Gray Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 Adam Peaty of England competes in the men's 50m breaststroke at the Commonwealth Games. REUTERS/David Gray Close 20 / 24 
Border Patrol agents keep watch during the official start for the construction of new bollard wall to replace 20-miles of primary vehicle barriers in Santa Teresa, New Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 Border Patrol agents keep watch during the official start for the construction of new bollard wall to replace 20-miles of primary vehicle barriers in Santa Teresa, New Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Close 21 / 24 
A boy receives polio vaccine drops, during an anti-polio campaign, in a low-income neighbourhood in Karachi, Pakistan. REUTERS/Akhtar Soomro Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 A boy receives polio vaccine drops, during an anti-polio campaign, in a low-income neighbourhood in Karachi, Pakistan. REUTERS/Akhtar Soomro Close 22 / 24 
2018 Masters winner Patrick Reed takes a selfie at the top of the Empire State Building in New York. REUTERS/Elly Park Reuters / Monday, April 09, 2018 2018 Masters winner Patrick Reed takes a selfie at the top of the Empire State Building in New York. REUTERS/Elly Park Close 23 / 24 
Artist Tracey Emin's new piece is installed next to the clock at St Pancras station in London. REUTERS/Hannah McKay Reuters / Tuesday, April 10, 2018 Artist Tracey Emin's new piece is installed next to the clock at St Pancras station in London. REUTERS/Hannah McKay Close
